Когда я начал перепроходить ради ачивок, переключил озвучку на английскую и из моих ушей перестала течь кровь.
Я даже и не знал о многих культовых секретах, а когда стал проходить испытания(головоломки) я узнал о многих хитростях этой игры.

本編は短い。初見でも2～5時間ぐらいでクリアできちゃうと思う。
実績全解除をやろうと思うと、＋数十時間が必要になると思う。MODもあるしハマれば結構長く遊べる。
セールで安い時に買っても損はないと思うよ。

I did unfortunately experience some bugs in the PC version that never occurred for me in the PS3 version—sometimes those energy ball target switches will trigger for no reason.  I had two puzzles "solve themselves" in this fashion in the same playthrough.

One of my favourites. Sounds, gameplay, storyline and fun factor 10/10. Graphics = Source engine standards.

But overall 10/10 totally worth any price below 25€!

Moderate replay value, soundtrack is good, fun for any science nerd willing to listen to verbal abuse.
Fun and definitely for those who like brain challenges.

This was an excellent game. It requires some coordination and timing, and a lot of strategy and patience. The humor in the presentation was really good, it made me laugh out loud a few times. My only complaint is that when "flinging" the character automatically re-orients so that feet are oriented down (towards the earth). This rotation while flying for me was a little nauseating. So when I perform a fling often I would close my eyes after entering the portal. For this reason I give the game an 8 instead of a 9 or 10.

When I first played this I had no idea what it was. Unfortunately, that's nearly impossible to experience now that it is so heavily hyped. Fortunately, the hype is well earned.
This is an innovative game that only proves further how amazing Valve is at reinventing genres. It's puzzle, platformer, FPS, and with a hilarious and unique story that you will love. This first game is a bit short, but the Challenges and Time Trials offer plenty of replay value.
Much like anything by Valve, if you don't have this already, you must grab it.

Portal-миниатюрное пазл-дополнение к серии Half-Life 2.Главная героиня игры заключена в застенки таинственной исследовательской лаборатории.Из арсенала у нее лишь специальная пушка,которая может создавать порталы.Задача-с помощью этого портала разгадать несколько десятков пазлов.Несмотря на всю кажущуюся простоту,игра отличается увлекательным и разнообразным геймплеем,а также-фантастическим стилем и интересным сюжетом.

Me encanta este juego, y la segunda parte es mejor.
La voz que te acompaña todo el tiempo es muy graciosa y el juego es un reto tras otro

Portal est un super jeu, en vue FPS, malgré que cela n'en soit pas un.
C'est un jeu qui vous demandera de la réflexion, qui vous fera reflechir car il est rempli de casses-tête.
Ce jeu est rempli d'humour noir, et c'est tout ce qui fait le charme du jeu, avec de beaux graphismes.
La voix de Glados est exellente !
Bref, j'adore ce jeu, dommage qu'il se finisse assez rapidement, suivant votre logique. (je l'ai fini en 2-3h).
Les premiers niveaux servent plus de tutoriels que de vrais niveaux (seul les derniers niveaux sont réellement compliqués)

Have you ever wanted to solve puzzles and eat cake... well this game isn't for you. Portal is a great puzzle/ action game, with enjoyable commentary and a likable sub-character. The gameplay is solid from the very beginning to the very end, levels get harder and harder as you progress through the game. If I had any complaints about the game it have to be how long the game is, yes you can replay it, but after playing it a first time you know all the puzzles off the top of your head. If you have a few extra dollars in your wallet, portal is a must have in your collection.

I finished Portal 2 before I played the first installment so this didn't have quite the impact on me that the second one did. It shares many of the same characteristics as the second (wonderfully rendered, detailed environments, innovative physics and game play, challenging levels, etc) but for me, the game was too short. I finished it in about a little over half of the time it took me to finsh the second one (and I don't like to speed through games; I like to take them in and enjoy the details that the developers put into them. I have a background in 2D/3D graphcs so I know something about what goes into these environments).

Also lacking (sadly) was the humor I found so enjoyable in the second game. There also wasn't much in the way of a story to explain why you were there; I kept waiting for the story to develop to fill in these blanks but it never really materialized.

That said, it was still a great game and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I suggest Portal 1 first; this will give you a greater appreciation for how much work these folks put into the second one, and it really showed.

Es un juego de puzzles muy interesante. Forma parte del universo de Half-Life.

Classic but short yet allows for mods

Portal is in many ways a strange game. At it's core it's a puzzle game, not something most people would consider mainstream but through a great sense of innovation as well as some truly inspired writing it somehow manages to pull it off.

The concept of Portal is simple enough. You progress through a series of rooms. In each room you must get from the entrance to the exit overcoming whatever obstacles and dangers might be in there using nothing but your trusty portal gun. The portal gun, quite simply, "shoots" a portal entrance onto a flat surface which allows you to travel through it.

This fairly simple concept does get quite a bit more tricky as you progress through the game as moving platforms, lasers, turrets and many other troublesome entities try to stop you.

Throughout the game you are accompanied by the sometimes scolding, somethings taunting and sometimes soothing voice of G.L.A.D.O.S. The AI in charge of your training and who might be a little mentally unstable as you'll soon discover. Although G.L.A.D.O.S is the only voice you'll hear in the game she does a fantastic job of keeping your entertained throughout your journey. The humor is some of the best you'll see in a game and the storyline is interesting enough that you'll pay attention to every little tidbit you encounter.

The only negative to be mentioned is the very short length of the game that leaves you wanting more. Sadly, the only alternative to replaying the game and pretending to be surprised is the challenges which are fairly boring rinse and repeat because of their extremely unforgiving nature.

Portal is a great game and one that any Steam user should have in his library, not just because it's been given away for free to all users not once, but twice. But because it is a truly impressive game experience.
Unexpected humour, just the right level of challenging and a simple but effective story line make Portal well worth a play.

Portal 1 is short and sweet. Good fun while it lasts. The puzzles are a bit easy, but for an introduction into the portal universe (Portal 2 being a bit more challenging), this is good. I'd say that this is a good game to introduce someone new into video games.
If you haven't played this you are missing out. No seriously, if you haven't played this game, get it now. One of the probably best puzzle games you will ever play.
fun very easy to beat as soon as you get used to it this game is fun
It's a fun game... Tho once you get to the end I don't see that you'll want to play it again and agian.... Still something you should play at least once!

What else is there to say about Portal that hasn't already been said? It's fantastic and set a new precedent in gaming for this generation, showing that truly original concepts and fascinating story can trump good graphics and developer ownership.

Portal is astounding, and if you haven't played it, you really ought to. Though, make sure you have enough money spare for Portal 2; I guarantee you'll want to buy it as soona s you're done with Portal!
